title: Fretblanket - Twisted (single) [1994][mp3-280]_infx222
description:
If a big shiny Olympic-style medal were given to the English band that sounded the most American, this distinctly Anglican quartet would be sportin' the gold. Surprisingly Fretblanket have transcended the Seattleisms most American-sounding foreign bands have opted for recently, and they head straight for America's breadbasket, the great Midwest. They take a hefty swing at Soul Asylum's pensive, hearty, and highly melodic angst ridden anthems, without blatantly nicking their moves. Vocalist/guitarist Will Copley's raspy croaking gives an edge to the music that some of the slick production has polished off and he adds subtle vocal hooks that make songs like "Twisted" attractive without being gaudy. It's good solid rock and roll, in spite of its sketchy origins.

Description from Amazon.com



As always... If you do like it PLEASE support the artist.
